summary: The Security Council of the United Nations adopted Resolution 970 (1995) on 12 January 1995, welcoming the measures taken by the authorities of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (Serbia and Montenegro) to maintain the effective closure of the international border between the two countries. The resolution also calls upon all States and others concerned to respect the sovereignty, territorial integrity and international borders of all States in the region, and requests the Committee established by resolution 724 (1991) to expedite its elaboration of appropriate streamlined procedures. The Secretary-General is requested to submit a report every thirty days to review the implementation of the decision to close the border.
title: S/RES/970(1995)
